tx_submission_methods.name: blob.Submit
tx_submission_methods.summary: Submit sends Blobs and reports the height in which they were included. Allows sending multiple Blobs atomically synchronously. Uses default wallet registered on the Node.

tx_submission_methods.name: da.Submit
tx_submission_methods.summary: Submit submits the Blobs to Data Availability layer. This method is synchronous. Upon successful submission to Data Availability layer, it returns the IDs identifying blobs in DA. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

tx_submission_methods.name: da.SubmitWithOptions
tx_submission_methods.summary: SubmitWithOptions submits the Blobs to Data Availability layer. This method is synchronous. Upon successful submission to Data Availability layer, it returns the IDs identifying blobs in DA. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

tx_submission_methods.name: state.SubmitPayForBlob
tx_submission_methods.summary: SubmitPayForBlob builds, signs and submits a PayForBlob transaction.

blob.name: blob.Get
blob.summary: Get retrieves the blob by commitment under the given namespace and height.

blob.name: blob.GetAll
blob.summary: GetAll returns all blobs under the given namespaces at the given height. If all blobs were found without any errors, the user will receive a list of blobs. If the BlobService couldn't find any blobs under the requested namespaces, the user will receive an empty list of blobs along with an empty error. If some of the requested namespaces were not found, the user will receive all the found blobs and an empty error. If there were internal errors during some of the requests, the user will receive all found blobs along with a combined error message. All blobs will preserve the order of the namespaces that were requested.

blob.name: blob.GetCommitmentProof
blob.summary: GetCommitmentProof generates a commitment proof for a share commitment.

blob.name: blob.GetProof
blob.summary: GetProof retrieves proofs in the given namespaces at the given height by commitment.

blob.name: blob.Included
blob.summary: Included checks whether a blob's given commitment(Merkle subtree root) is included at given height and under the namespace.

blob.name: blob.Submit
blob.summary: Submit sends Blobs and reports the height in which they were included. Allows sending multiple Blobs atomically synchronously. Uses default wallet registered on the Node.

blob.name: blob.Subscribe
blob.summary: Subscribe to published blobs from the given namespace as they are included.

blobstream.name: blobstream.GetDataRootTupleInclusionProof
blobstream.summary: GetDataRootTupleInclusionProof creates an inclusion proof, for the data root tuple of block height `height`, in the set of blocks defined by `start` and `end`. The range is end exclusive. It's in the header module because it only needs access to the headers to generate the proof.

blobstream.name: blobstream.GetDataRootTupleRoot
blobstream.summary: GetDataRootTupleRoot collects the data roots over a provided ordered range of blocks, and then creates a new Merkle root of those data roots. The range is end exclusive. It's in the header module because it only needs access to the headers to generate the proof.

da.name: da.Commit
da.summary: Commit creates a Commitment for each given Blob. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.Get
da.summary: Get returns Blob for each given ID, or an error. Error should be returned if ID is not formatted properly, there is no Blob for given ID or any other client-level error occurred (dropped connection, timeout, etc). Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.GetIDs
da.summary: GetIDs returns IDs of all Blobs located in DA at given height. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.GetProofs
da.summary: GetProofs returns inclusion Proofs for Blobs specified by their IDs. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.MaxBlobSize
da.summary: MaxBlobSize returns the max blob size Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.Submit
da.summary: Submit submits the Blobs to Data Availability layer. This method is synchronous. Upon successful submission to Data Availability layer, it returns the IDs identifying blobs in DA. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.SubmitWithOptions
da.summary: SubmitWithOptions submits the Blobs to Data Availability layer. This method is synchronous. Upon successful submission to Data Availability layer, it returns the IDs identifying blobs in DA. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

da.name: da.Validate
da.summary: Validate validates Commitments against the corresponding Proofs. This should be possible without retrieving the Blobs. Deprecated: This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

das.name: das.SamplingStats
das.summary: SamplingStats returns the current statistics over the DA sampling process.

das.name: das.WaitCatchUp
das.summary: WaitCatchUp blocks until DASer finishes catching up to the network head.

fraud.name: fraud.Get
fraud.summary: Get fetches fraud proofs from the disk by its type.

fraud.name: fraud.Subscribe
fraud.summary: Subscribe allows to subscribe on a Proof pub sub topic by its type.

header.name: header.GetByHash
header.summary: GetByHash returns the header of the given hash from the node's header store.

header.name: header.GetByHeight
header.summary: GetByHeight returns the ExtendedHeader at the given height if it is currently available.

header.name: header.GetRangeByHeight
header.summary: GetRangeByHeight returns the given range (from:to) of ExtendedHeaders from the node's header store and verifies that the returned headers are adjacent to each other.

header.name: header.LocalHead
header.summary: LocalHead returns the ExtendedHeader of the chain head.

header.name: header.NetworkHead
header.summary: NetworkHead provides the Syncer's view of the current network head.

header.name: header.Subscribe
header.summary: Subscribe to recent ExtendedHeaders from the network.

header.name: header.SyncState
header.summary: SyncState returns the current state of the header Syncer.

header.name: header.SyncWait
header.summary: SyncWait blocks until the header Syncer is synced to network head.

header.name: header.Tail
header.summary: Tail reports current tail header of the node. Tail header is the lowest height header known by the running node. Headers with height below Tail are not available to be requested. Subsequently, Shwap data requests for this height are not available as well. NOTE: In future, requests for headers below Tail will be supported by lazily fetching them from the network.

header.name: header.WaitForHeight
header.summary: WaitForHeight blocks until the header at the given height has been processed by the store or context deadline is exceeded.

node.name: node.AuthNew
node.summary: AuthNew signs and returns a new token with the given permissions.

node.name: node.AuthNewWithExpiry
node.summary: AuthNewWithExpiry signs and returns a new token with the given permissions and TTL.

node.name: node.AuthVerify
node.summary: AuthVerify returns the permissions assigned to the given token.

node.name: node.Info
node.summary: Info returns administrative information about the node.

node.name: node.LogLevelSet
node.summary: LogLevelSet sets the given component log level to the given level.

node.name: node.Ready
node.summary: Ready returns true once the node's RPC is ready to accept requests.

p2p.name: p2p.BandwidthForPeer
p2p.summary: BandwidthForPeer returns a Stats struct with bandwidth metrics associated with the given peer.ID. The metrics returned include all traffic sent / received for the peer, regardless of protocol.

p2p.name: p2p.BandwidthForProtocol
p2p.summary: BandwidthForProtocol returns a Stats struct with bandwidth metrics associated with the given protocol.ID.

p2p.name: p2p.BandwidthStats
p2p.summary: BandwidthStats returns a Stats struct with bandwidth metrics for all data sent/received by the local peer, regardless of protocol or remote peer IDs.

p2p.name: p2p.BlockPeer
p2p.summary: BlockPeer adds a peer to the set of blocked peers and closes any existing connection to that peer.

p2p.name: p2p.ClosePeer
p2p.summary: ClosePeer closes the connection to a given peer.

p2p.name: p2p.Connect
p2p.summary: Connect ensures there is a connection between this host and the peer with given peer.

p2p.name: p2p.Connectedness
p2p.summary: Connectedness returns a state signaling connection capabilities.

p2p.name: p2p.ConnectionState
p2p.summary: ConnectionState returns information about each *active* connection to the peer. NOTE: At most cases there should be only a single connection.

p2p.name: p2p.Info
p2p.summary: Info returns address information about the host.

p2p.name: p2p.IsProtected
p2p.summary: IsProtected returns whether the given peer is protected.

p2p.name: p2p.ListBlockedPeers
p2p.summary: ListBlockedPeers returns a list of blocked peers.

p2p.name: p2p.NATStatus
p2p.summary: NATStatus returns the current NAT status.

p2p.name: p2p.PeerInfo
p2p.summary: PeerInfo returns a small slice of information Peerstore has on the given peer.

p2p.name: p2p.Peers
p2p.summary: Peers returns connected peers.

p2p.name: p2p.Ping
p2p.summary: Ping pings the selected peer and returns time it took or error.

p2p.name: p2p.Protect
p2p.summary: Protect adds a peer to the list of peers who have a bidirectional peering agreement that they are protected from being trimmed, dropped or negatively scored.

p2p.name: p2p.PubSubPeers
p2p.summary: PubSubPeers returns the peer IDs of the peers joined on the given topic.

p2p.name: p2p.PubSubTopics
p2p.summary: PubSubTopics reports current PubSubTopics the node participates in.

p2p.name: p2p.ResourceState
p2p.summary: ResourceState returns the state of the resource manager.

p2p.name: p2p.UnblockPeer
p2p.summary: UnblockPeer removes a peer from the set of blocked peers.

p2p.name: p2p.Unprotect
p2p.summary: Unprotect removes a peer from the list of peers who have a bidirectional peering agreement that they are protected from being trimmed, dropped or negatively scored, returning a bool representing whether the given peer is protected or not.

share.name: share.GetEDS
share.summary: GetEDS retrieves the complete Extended Data Square (EDS) for the specified height. The EDS contains all shares organized in a 2D matrix format with erasure coding. Returns the full EDS or an error if retrieval fails.

share.name: share.GetNamespaceData
share.summary: GetNamespaceData retrieves all shares that belong to the specified namespace within the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height. The shares are returned in a row-by-row order, maintaining the original layout if the namespace spans multiple rows. Returns the namespace data or an error if retrieval fails.

share.name: share.GetRange
share.summary: GetRange retrieves a range of the *original* shares and their corresponding proofs within a specific namespace in the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height. The range is defined by start and end indexes. Returns the range data with proof to the data root or an error if retrieval fails.

share.name: share.GetRow
share.summary: GetRow retrieves all shares from a specific row in the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height. Returns the complete row of shares or an error if retrieval fails.

share.name: share.GetSamples
share.summary: GetSamples retrieves multiple shares from the Extended Data Square (EDS) specified by the header at the given sample coordinates. Returns an array of samples containing the requested shares or an error if retrieval fails.

share.name: share.GetShare
share.summary: GetShare retrieves a specific share from the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height using its row and column coordinates. Returns the share data or an error if retrieval fails.

share.name: share.SharesAvailable
share.summary: SharesAvailable performs a subjective validation to check if the shares committed to the ExtendedHeader at the specified height are available and retrievable from the network. Returns an error if the shares are not available or if validation fails.

state.name: state.AccountAddress
state.summary: AccountAddress retrieves the address of the node's account/signer

state.name: state.Balance
state.summary: Balance retrieves the Celestia coin balance for the node's account/signer and verifies it against the corresponding block's AppHash.

state.name: state.BalanceForAddress
state.summary: BalanceForAddress retrieves the Celestia coin balance for the given address and verifies the returned balance against the corresponding block's AppHash. NOTE: the balance returned is the balance reported by the block right before the node's current head (head-1). This is due to the fact that for block N, the block's `AppHash` is the result of applying the previous block's transaction list.

state.name: state.BeginRedelegate
state.summary: BeginRedelegate sends a user's delegated tokens to a new validator for redelegation.

state.name: state.CancelUnbondingDelegation
state.summary: CancelUnbondingDelegation cancels a user's pending undelegation from a validator.

state.name: state.Delegate
state.summary: Delegate sends a user's liquid tokens to a validator for delegation.

state.name: state.GrantFee
state.summary: No comment exists yet for this method.

state.name: state.QueryDelegation
state.summary: QueryDelegation retrieves the delegation information between a delegator and a validator.

state.name: state.QueryRedelegations
state.summary: QueryRedelegations retrieves the status of the redelegations between a delegator and a validator.

state.name: state.QueryUnbonding
state.summary: QueryUnbonding retrieves the unbonding status between a delegator and a validator.

state.name: state.RevokeGrantFee
state.summary: No comment exists yet for this method.

state.name: state.SubmitPayForBlob
state.summary: SubmitPayForBlob builds, signs and submits a PayForBlob transaction.

state.name: state.Transfer
state.summary: Transfer sends the given amount of coins from default wallet of the node to the given account address.

state.name: state.Undelegate
state.summary: Undelegate undelegates a user's delegated tokens, unbonding them from the current validator.

If the BlobService couldn't find any blobs under the requested namespaces, the user will receive an empty list of blobs along with an empty error. If some of the requested namespaces were not found, the user will receive all the found blobs and an empty error. If there were internal errors during some of the requests, the user will receive all found blobs along with a combined error message. All blobs will preserve the order of the namespaces that were requested.

methods.name: share.GetEDS
methods.summary: GetEDS retrieves the complete Extended Data Square (EDS) for the specified height. The EDS contains all shares organized in a 2D matrix format with erasure coding. Returns the full EDS or an error if retrieval fails.

methods.name: share.GetNamespaceData
methods.summary: GetNamespaceData retrieves all shares that belong to the specified namespace within the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height. The shares are returned in a row-by-row order, maintaining the original layout if the namespace spans multiple rows. Returns the namespace data or an error if retrieval fails.

methods.name: share.GetRange
methods.summary: GetRange retrieves a range of the *original* shares and their corresponding proofs within a specific namespace in the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height. The range is defined by start and end indexes. Returns the range data with proof to the data root or an error if retrieval fails.

methods.name: share.GetRow
methods.summary: GetRow retrieves all shares from a specific row in the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height. Returns the complete row of shares or an error if retrieval fails.

methods.name: share.GetSamples
methods.summary: GetSamples retrieves multiple shares from the Extended Data Square (EDS) specified by the header at the given sample coordinates. Returns an array of samples containing the requested shares or an error if retrieval fails.

methods.name: share.GetShare
methods.summary: GetShare retrieves a specific share from the Extended Data Square (EDS) at the given height using its row and column coordinates. Returns the share data or an error if retrieval fails.

methods.name: share.SharesAvailable
methods.summary: SharesAvailable performs a subjective validation to check if the shares committed to the ExtendedHeader at the specified height are available and retrievable from the network. Returns an error if the shares are not available or if validation fails.

methods.summary: BalanceForAddress retrieves the Celestia coin balance for the given address and verifies the returned balance against the corresponding block's AppHash. NOTE: the balance returned is the balance reported by the block right before the node's current head (head-1). This is due to the fact that for block N, the block's `AppHash` is the result of applying the previous block's transaction list.
